output.dependency: The airline column (describing the airline company) and the flight code column (describing a specific flight) are semantically dependent. Each flight code likely corresponds to flights operated by the mentioned airline.

The departure time column (describing the time a flight departs) and the arrival time column (describing the time a flight arrives) are syntactically dependent. The values in these columns represent time entries that are likely based on the same scheduled flight.

The flight code column (describing a specific flight based on a route) could syntactically determine the departure time column (indicating when the flight takes off) as each flight code is associated with specific scheduled departure times.

The flight code column (describing a specific flight based on a route) could syntactically determine the arrival time column (indicating when the flight is scheduled to arrive) since these values are expected to correspond to the respective flight.

The airline column (describing the airline company) and the unique identifier column (likely representing a database primary key for each record) have a potential dependency in that each flight entry would be recorded under a specific airline, or multiple records might exist for the same airline.
